intro: Horkelia laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pale blue petals. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, and it is adapted to arid environments. Horkelia laxiflora is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a characteristic species of certain ecological communities.
